alert.note: Alert for Kit Carson County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 11:30PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Kit Carson County through MIDNIGHT MDT... At 1129 PM MDT, the public reported a strong thunderstorm near Burlington, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Mesonet. Burlington Airport reported a gust of 50 mph. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Burlington around 1140 PM MDT. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Colorado between mile markers 414 and 450. Highway 385 between mile markers 170 and 199. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Goodland. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM MDT for east central Colorado.
